p.s: The given text is very informative but also argumentative.
The article is splitted in four paragraphs.
The author uses formal language and he uses some complicated words at a few points.
He doesn't make any jokes or something else he just tells us the facts and solutions that would be better than the way we try to solve the problem now.

I think the author wants to give us deeper insights about the situation in Bangladesh and he wants to make it easier to learn a new language for other people, because he went through it and he knows how hard it is sometimes.
Zia Haider Rahmanadressesaddresses the text to the readers of the Sunday Times.
She tries to convince the reader of her opinion, confronting them with the problem and she tells them how a young male boy is treated in Bangladesh.
Many people out there are emotional and they will feel sorry for these boys, and then they have the same opinion as Zia Haider Rahman.
In her text she doesn't use any metaphors, but she tells us a lot of our own story, probably to show the reader that it is very hard to learn a completely new language.
I would say that Zia is an expert of this theme because she had to go through it by herself and so she knows how much work it takes to learn English.
Generally you can say that Zia Haider Rahman tries ot convince the people of her opinion.
She explains the situation in Bangladesh and she explains how the people try to solve the problem.
She also tells us her own story, when she came to Britain and had to learn English.
